newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - June 9.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - June 9.

text.p: The following are the highlights of stories from the Irish press on Friday.
DUBLIN, June 9 (Reuter) - The following are highlights of stories from the Irish press on Monday:
- A full recount has been ordered in Dublin South East constituency where Progressive Democrat Michael McDowell and the Green party's John Gormley are battling for the final seat.
- Bertie Ahern is certain to have a clear majorty when the Dail meets to elect him Prime Minister.
- Bertie Ahern may offer the post of house speaker to a member of Fine Gael. If succesful this would instantly strengthen his hand in parliament.
- Fianna Fail leader Bertie Ahern will this week begin the process of forming a minority government with the support of two Independent members of parliament after the weekend election.
- Police belive a body found in the Shannon estuary may be that of JoJo Dullard, the Kilkenny woman whe went missing while hitch-hiking in 1995.
- EU Finance Minsiters are expected to try to reassure markets that their commitment to the euro timetable and strength is unwavering when they meet in Luxembourg today.
